messages.title: Why vote Labour?
messages.content: Scrap letting agent fees, increase length of standard tenancies, prevent landlords from hiking rent unfairly, build 1m new homes (including affordable homes). Decarbonise electricity market, invest in renewables, freeze energy bills, reform energy market and give Bristol new transport powers in law to freeze rail and bus services. Increase free childcare for 3/4 year olds, fund before and after school clubs, cut tuition fees, scrap zero hour contracts and help young people get jobs or apprenticeships.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Scrap letting agent fees, increase length of standard tenancies, prevent landlords from hiking rent unfairly, build 1m new homes (including affordable homes).
Decarbonise electricity market, invest in renewables, freeze energy bills, reform energy market and give Bristol new transport powers in law to freeze rail and bus services.
Increase free childcare for 3/4 year olds, fund before and after school clubs, cut tuition fees, scrap zero hour contracts and help young people get jobs or apprenticeships.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour's Darren Jones and the Tories are neck and neck at 32%, the Liberal Democrat candidate and the Greens are both on 10% of the share of the vote and the Lord Mayor next year and the other parties haven't even started campaigning yet.

issues.education: Increase free childcare for 3/4 year olds, fund before and after school clubs, cut tuition fees.
issues.environment: Decarbonise electricity market, invest in renewables.

housing.content: Scrap letting agent fees, increase length of standard tenancies, prevent landlords from hiking rent unfairly, build 1m new homes (including affordable homes).

leaflet.personalStatement: Darren is Labour's candidate to be the Bristol NW MP at the General Election on Thursday 7th May. If elected, Darren will be the first MP for Bristol NW to have been born and raised here. As a technology solicitor in Bristol Darren has worked on renewable energy and green tech projects.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by Brenda Massey on behalf of Darren Jones both at Unit 2, Filton Business Park, Golf Course Lane, Filton, Bristol BS34 7PQ.
